title: Upload death certificate
paragraph1: You can upload a scan or photo of the death certificate if you have an original certificate issued in the UK. You can use your phone to do this if it has a camera.
help: If you have an interim death certificate from the coroner, or a certificate issued outside the UK, you should continue with your application. You need to send the original document instead of uploading a scan or photo.
steps-item1: Place the certificate on a flat surface in a well lit room. Use a flash if you need to.
steps-item2: Take a good quality, colour picture of the entire document. You should be able to see its edges.
steps-item3: Check that the image is in focus. You must be able to see the watermark and read all the writing, including any handwriting. Zoom in if you need to check this.
steps-item4: Send the picture to this device (eg by email) and save it.
paragraph2: Your scan or photo must be in colour and show the entire certificate including the watermark. You can upload most types of image.
cantUploadDocumentsTitle: If you can’t upload your documents
cantUploadDocumentsText: Continue with your application. When you’re finished you’ll be given a reference number and details of where to send your documents by email or post.

invalidFileType.summary: You have used a file type that can’t be accepted. Save your file as a jpg, bmp, tiff, png or PDF file and try again

maxSize.summary: Your file is too large to upload. Use a file that is under 10MB and try again

maxFilesExceeded.summary: You have uploaded too many files. You can upload a maximum of 10 files

uploadFailed.summary: Your document failed to upload. Select your document and try again

nothingUploaded.summary: You need to select a file before you can upload it. Click ‘browse’ to find a file to upload

uploadTimeout.summary: The file has taken too long to upload. The file may be too big, reduce the file size and try again or post the death certificate
